title.narrative: Expanding Refugee Access to Protection and Integration

description.narrative: Asylum Access Mexico seeks to shift the refugee response paradigm in Mexico to address refugees holistic needs and complement ongoing humanitarian aid efforts. Through a combination of legal empowerment programs, community & movement building and livelihoods programs, AAMX aims to strengthen sustainable response mechanisms that ensure refugees can rebuild their rights. The AAMX model is centered on the idea that when refugees can access and understand their rights, they can develop the tools to effectively exercise them. Through the Hospitality Route initiative, AAMX will take a whole-society network building approach to connect refugees to public sector resources, private sector employment opportunities and livelihoods development programs. A general operating support grant of $20,000.00 from the Unitarian Universalist Service Committee will provide AAMX with the flexibility to build the capacity of its programs and lay the foundation for a stronger refugee-response community in Mexico.
